basics.name: Hung Chun Chang
basics.label: Researcher & M.Sc. Student in Psychology
basics.summary: Interdisciplinary researcher focusing on Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Social Robotics, and Intelligent Tutoring Systems. Experienced in developing empathetic AI algorithms and multimodal interfaces to improve well-being and learning accessibility.

work.name: Social Lab HRI group, National Taiwan University
work.summary: Focusing on human-robot interaction and multimodal data analysis under Prof. Hsiu Ping, Yueh.
highlights: Developed systems for 5+ HRI projects individually.
Held 2 workshops on multimodal data analysis and voice-based social robots.
Organized 2 training programs for undergraduate students.
Conducted user research over 28 sessions with 7 older adults for bachelor thesis.

work.name: Department of Psychology, National Taiwan University
highlights: Led 18+ hours of workshops for students on literature review, user testing, and prototyping.
Co-authored 2 conference posters during the course.

awards.title: Cathay Charity Foundation Excellence Scholarship
awards.summary: Recognized for bridge the digital divide through technology interaction between older adults and social robots.

awards.title: Startup Prize
awards.summary: Awarded for designing and implementing conversation robots for older adults.

projects.name: ECRobot, an ITS robot
projects.summary: An Intelligent Tutoring System containing an iPad app (Swift), NAO robot (Qi Python), and FastAPI backend.
highlights: Designed empathetic algorithm based on prospect theory.

projects.name: TouchHear
projects.summary: An AR assistive learning system for visually impaired students providing audio feedback for dotted figures.

projects.name: XiaoXiao, a companion robot
projects.summary: A companion VUI system with an engaging backstory for long-term elderly engagement.
highlights: Maintained 40+ minutes of average conversation duration.
